title: Rugby World Cup 2019: Live stream and TV details for Japan vs Ireland
text:
Ireland and Japan go head to head this Saturday as they both target a spot in the knockout stages of the Rugby World Cup.

Japan will be looking to build upon their victory against Russia while Joe Schmidt’s men head into the encounter, to be held in Shizuoka, on the back of their storming win over Scotland.

Whereas Ireland radiated with confidence and composure in their opening match, it was a more cagey affair for the Brave Blossoms.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Number eight Kazuki Himeno admitted his side were "spun" by the size of the occasion in the tournament opener, as they struggled to cope with the weight of expectation as the host nation.

"It wasn't like a usual Test match there was a different atmosphere, the crowd noise was really loud and a few things spun us during the game," said the 25-year-old Sunwolves back-rower. "But it's important we get back to our basics, what we are good at.” Victory over Ireland will go someway to securing a first-ever spot in the World Cup knockout stages.

How can I live stream it?

The game will be available to stream via the ITV Hub on your smartphone, desktop or tablet.

ITV1 will also be broadcasting the match on terrestrial TV.

When is it?

Japan vs Ireland takes place on Saturday 28 September at the Shizuoka Stadium.

What time does it start?

The match kicks off at 4.15pm Japan Standard Time, which is 8.15am BST.

Teams

Japan XV: To be announced

Ireland XV: To be announced

Prediction

Ireland ultimately have too much talent and ability for the hosts. Although Japan might offer more resistance than the Scottish, it’s hard to see Jamie Joseph’s men keeping out the Irish for long. I’m expecting a feisty contest at the breakdown but it’s in the backline where this match will eventually be decided.
